txt.en: 'You've made your point, rat!'
'Get out of here with your friend before I change my mind.'
'What's he saying, boss?'
Talk to Bilbo Baggins in the depths of Goblin-town
Having found Bilbo Baggins within the dungeons of Goblin-town, you must now return him safely to the surface!
Talk to Bilbo in Goblin-town
Talk to Bauglám Fork-tongue
Defeat Bauglám Fork-tongue in single combat
Defeat Thukafak in single combat
Remain alert for further trouble
'The prisoner is escaping!'
'Someone tell Bauglám his prisoner is getting away!'
'Don't you think we should talk things over?'
'This is clearly just a misunderstanding....'
'May I confer with my friend for a moment?'
'I have had an idea, my friend!'
'You have already proven yourself to be a most effective fighter.'
'Did you not beat that other fellow and his finest warriors? What was his name?'
'What would you say to another contest? A game to prove your mettle?'
'Single combat! If you beat [placeholder], I will lead you to my treasure.'
'And if [placeholder] beats you, we are permitted to leave.'
'Oh my.'
'Stop, prisoner! And you too, helpful [placeholder]!'
'I did not steal you away from Sorrog Crows-eye to let you go now!'
'Let's get out of here before he changes his mind!'
'No! You spoke of treasure, and I mean to have it!'
'Where are these sacks of gold?'

Bilbo lowers his voice and speaks to you in little more than a whisper.

'When I was walking in the mountains, I was captured by a party of goblins, and they started hauling me to their camp. We had gone no more than a hundred feet or so when a second patrol of the creatures came up, led by this fellow. Now, I wouldn't say I'm an expert on goblin-kind, but I have had enough run-ins with them to know that they love gold more than anything. So I had to think fast, and... well, I told them I had been an adventurer in my younger days, and I had hidden sacks of gold in the mountains.

'The goblins fought among themselves for the right to my treasure, just as I thought they would! This fellow won the contest right quickly, before I could get away, and the next thing I knew I was locked in that cell here in Goblin-town! I couldn't tell them the truth, of course: that there were no sacks of gold. When I adventured with the dwarves I did end up with two small chests of silver and of gold, but that was a long time ago and they were never as large as the rumours around the Hill would put them!'

Bilbo claps his hands together. 'I think I've got it!' he says. 'You'll get us out of this, [placeholder], trust me!'
'Sorrog Crows-eye? I would not boast about besting that weakling!'
'I am listening.'
'Up here, it's got to be!'
'Hmmmm. Single combat? One-on-one?'

'Single combat seems fair to me. No one can intervene. This will be a test of strength, one-on-one, and everyone here agrees this is fair, yes?'

Bauglám Fork-tongue stares at you, his lip curled in a sneer.

'There is no backing out now, [placeholder]. Are you prepared to fight?'
'Hold on, [placeholder].'
'You should still do most of the fighting! None would mistake me for Thorin Oakenshield!'
'I agree to this contest.'
Bauglám Fork-tongue seems especially pleased with himself.
'Okay, I think it's safe.'
'Well now, look at this, [placeholder].'
'Hold your cave-claws, friend.'
'We're lucky the goblins don't seem to be home....'
'When last I was here, I didn't get a good look at the place.'
'I'd feel better if I still had Sting!'
'That's not surprising, of course.'
'No, Frodo has more use for Sting now than I have, poor lad!'
'It is hard to see anything when you're in the clutches of goblins!'
'Ah!'
'That would have been the end of my tale and Thorin's both, if not for Gandalf.'
'This will do. It's not Sting, but at least I shall not be helpless.'
'But this time Gandalf isn't near at hand.'
You defeated Bauglám Fork-tongue's champion. Will he now agree to the terms of the contest?
'Let's go, [placeholder].'
'Thank you for coming to find me, [placeholder].'
DNT - Blah!
'Ah, we had better keep moving.'
Mission: The Further Adventures of Bilbo Baggins, Chapter 10
'Up, up! That's the way out of Goblin-town!'
'Let us hurry to the surface, [placeholder]! I have seen more than enough of Goblin-town to last a lifetime, or even two!'
Bauglám Fork-tongue has chosen the troll Thukafak to face you in single combat.
You are reminded, once again, that goblins cannot be trusted
Wait for Bilbo to try and talk his way out of it
You have won the contest!
Your rescue of Bilbo Baggins from Goblin-town will not be complete until you have returned him safely to the surface!
Bilbo has asked to speak to you before dealing again with Bauglám Fork-tongue.
Protect Bilbo Baggins while he escapes from Goblin-town
Bauglám Fork-tongue seems strangely confident about facing you in single combat.
'It looks like we've won, Bauglám!'
'Now you have to let us go.'
'This is to be single combat, yes, one-on-one.'
'Yes, what do these fellows think?'
'Do you think they'll understand that you're going back on a bargain?'
'But I never agreed to be the one you will be fighting!'
'And if you won't deal fairly with us, might you cheat them too?'
'Thukafak! Get over here!'
'Maybe he offered to split my gold with you?'
'Kill the [placeholder], my pet!'
'Smartly decided, Bauglám! Let's go, [placeholder]!'
'Do I?'
'What do you think, boys?'
Bilbo has been defeated, and you have failed!
'Don't you worry about it.'
